channel.title: How do you make a loading bar in a .bat file?
channel.description: i think this might go in general programming but, its kinda a question also. i need a loading bar to go like [=======> ] all the way accross. How do you make these, i have seen people with them before..

item.title: How do you make a loading bar in a .bat file?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

the only way to do it in batch is to keep clearing the screen and echo’ing everything again (afaik)

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make a loading bar in a .bat file?

item.title: How do you make a loading bar in a .bat file?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“parad0x_, post:4, topic:91954”]wget is a command you use on Linux systems.
He was just saying that wget does that automatically, obviously you’re on Windows.[/quote]

There’s also a .exe wget used in windows, you use it by placing the .exe in the same file as the .bat and in the bat, use it the same as Linux terminal commands, I’ve seen it be used a few times on windows.

wget is a tool to download files from internet locations if you were wondering.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make a loading bar in a .bat file?
